Then, draw another circle with center at (0.1713, 0.1713) and radius 0.0539 on the X-Y plane. This forms loop 2 of face 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3426. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0571, 0.0571, 0.0). Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D by a depth of 0.4253 towards the normal and 0 depth in the opposite direction. This results in a solid object with height 0.4253, width and length of 0.3426, and a slightly tapered shape. **Part 2: Cylindrical Object Top** Construct a second cylindrical object that forms the top of the first object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.0571, 0.0571, 0.4253) with euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). For the 2D sketch, draw a circle with center at (0.1713, 0.1713) and radius 0.1713 on the X-Y plane. This forms loop 1 of face 1. Then, draw another circle with center at (0.1713, 0.1713) and radius 0.1142 on the X-Y plane. This forms loop 2 of face 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3426. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0571, 0.0571, 0.4253). Extrude the 2D sketch into 3D by a depth of 0.2676 towards the normal and 0 depth in the opposite direction. This results in a solid object with height 0.2676, width and length of 0.3426, forming the top of the first object. The resulting CAD model will be a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom. The top is slightly wider than the bottom, and the object is symmetrical along its central axis. The overall height of the object is the sum of the heights of parts 1 and 2 (0.4253 + 0.2676 = 0.6929).</description>
